    "instructions": "To prepare the Goat Biryani, follow these steps:\n\n1. **Marinate the Goat**: In a bowl, combine the goat meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, and a pinch of salt. Allow it to marinate for at least 30 minutes.\n\n2. **Sauté Onions**: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Remove half for garnishing.\n\n3. **Cook Tomatoes**: In the same pot, add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add the marinated goat meat and sauté until it changes color.\n\n4. **Add Rice**: Boil water in a separate pot, add salt, and cook the basmati rice until it is 70% done. Drain and set aside.\n\n5. **Layer the Biryani**: In the pot with goat and tomato mixture, layer the partially cooked rice over it. Add chopped mint and coriander leaves, green chilies, and the reserved fried onions on top.\n\n6. **Dum Cooking**: Cover the pot with a tight lid and cook on low heat for about 25-30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.\n\n7. **Serve**: Fluff the biryani gently before serving. Garnish with more mint and coriander if desired. Enjoy your Goat Biryani!",
